results.title: Rock n' roll the greatest years: 1967 volume 2
results.brief_description: Relive some of the great hits of the year 1967, including; “Happy Jack” (The Who), “Autumn almanac” (The Kinks), “Zabadak” (Dave Dee Dozy Beaky Mick & Tich), “San Franciscan nights” (Eric Burdon), “Dedicated to the one I love” (Mamas & Papas), “Respect” (Aretha Franklin), “Mellow yellow” (Donovan), “Hole in my shoe” (Traffic), Soothe me” (Sam & Dave), “I can see for miles” (The Who), “I’m a man (The Spencer Davis Group), “The Wind cries Mary” (Jimi Hendrix experience), “Sweet soul music” (Arthur Conley) and “Creek alley” (Mamas & Papas).

results.title: Rock Hudson's home movies
results.brief_description: This documentary takes the film-clip biography to new heights. Narrated by ‘Rock’ it wittily dissects the late star’s screen career in the light of the now known facts of his life— that he was gay and died from AIDS. The film presents a new image of Hollywood’s leading romantic screen idol of the 50s and 60s by closely examining his screen roles for ‘hidden meanings’ Both poignant and funny it exposes the ‘queerness’ the sits just below the surface of mainstream Hollywood film.

results.title: Rock guitar: a guide from the greats
results.creator_credit: Longman Group, Eric Fellner and Simon Milne
results.brief_description: This entertaining documentary is a guide to how to play rock guitar, especially guitar licks. Features interviews and instructional segments with ace guitarists Ron Wood (Rolling Stones), Michael Schenker, Richard Thompson and John Wilson, as well as footage of Jimi Hendrix and Chuck Berry. Includes information on how to tune a guitar and play chords, right hand technique, polishing a rhythm or solo, and advice on choosing a guitar.

results.title: Rock engravings
results.brief_description: Aboriginal rock carvings in Western New South Wales are being studied by archaeologists to discover their significance and to throw light on the culture which produced them. The age of the carvings cannot be determined, but many may be thousands of years old.

results.title: Rock bottom at Waikaremoana
results.brief_description: The lake at Waikaremoana is one of the North Island’s major sources of water for hydro-electric power. However, weakness in the bed of the lake has resulted in considerable loss of valuable water. With a full-sized movie camera fitted in his special diving helmet, a cameraman recorded how divers located and sealed these leaks in the lake bed.

results.title: Rock 'n' roll and the 1950's. Vols 5-6. Big beat legends: the evolution of rock on television
results.creator_credit: Video 45, Diamond Productions and Renaissance Theatre Company
results.brief_description: Rock ‘n’ roll and the 1950’s presents volumes 5 and 6 from their collection of rare and historical footage which captures the energy and values of the 1950’s that embodied the Rock & Roll culture. Featured is live performance clips along with movie trailers, advertisements and other footage that describe the mood of the day and it’s cultural values. Volume 5 along with musical performances features footage celebrating the sci-fi film genre and the TV serial. Volume 6 features footage of some of the bombshells that represented changing values on sexuality in the fifties. Included are televised performances of: Jane Mansfield, Lavern Baker, Chuck Berry, Frankie Lyman. Included in this double-feature is documentary “The Big beat legend: the evolution of rock on television”. This documentary looks at Alan Freed, the New York DJ who coined the phrase ‘rock n’ roll’ and played without prejudice the music of both black and white performers equally. Included are: the Exciters, Bill Haley, Fats Domino, The Platters, Frankie Lynman and the Teenagers, Bobby Darin, The Diamonds, Dion, Jerry Lee Lewis and Jackie Wilson.

results.title: Rock 'n' roll and the 1950's. Vols 1-4
results.brief_description: Rock ‘n’ roll and the 1950’s presents in four volumes a collection of rare and historical footage without commentary that captures the energy and values of the 1950s that embodied the Rock & Roll culture. Featured is live performance clips along with movie trailers, advertisements and other footage that describe the mood of the day and it’s cultural values. Included are televised performances of: Bill Haley and The Comets, Fats Domino, The Platters, Gene Vincent, the Everly Brothers, Bobby Darin, Charlie Grace, Jerry Lee Lewis, Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens and of course Elvis Presley.
results.description: Rock ‘n’ roll and the 1950’s presents in four volumes a collection of rare and historical footage without commentary that captures the energy and values of the 1950s that embodied the Rock & Roll culture. Featured is live performance clips along with movie trailers, advertisements and other footage that describe the mood of the day and it’s cultural values. Included are televised performances of: Bill Haley and The Comets, Fats Domino, The Platters, Gene Vincent, the Everly Brothers, Bobby Darin, Charlie Grace, Jerry Lee Lewis, Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens and of course Elvis Presley.

Featured is live performance clips along with movie trailers, advertisements and other footage that describe the mood of the day and it’s cultural values. Included are televised performances of: Bill Haley and The Comets, Fats Domino, The Platters, Gene Vincent, the Everly Brothers, Bobby Darin, Charlie Grace, Jerry Lee Lewis, Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens and of course Elvis Presley.

results.title: Rock-a-bye
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Jacques Bensimon
results.brief_description: Popular idols of the rock music scene - The Rolling Stones, The Stampeders, Whiskey Howl, Alice Cooper, Muddy Waters - are seen and heard in this film. It is a penetrating look at the whole pop music sub-culture and what keeps it alive, filmed in Canada, on and off-stage, and behind the scenes at record companies, radio broadcasting studios, and board rooms where hucksters plan the sales campaigns. The film includes personal interviews in which some of the stars explain what it’s all about and features Alice Cooper hacking a doll to pieces on stage. Obscene language has been bleeped out.

results.title: Robots: computers at work (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Before we consider the impact of robots on our lives, we need to know more about how they work, what they can do, and how scientists and engineers see them developing in the future. This film takes its examples mainly from Japan where more robots are currently in use than in any other country, including U.S.A.
